required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Performance of Short- and Long-term Baseplates for Attaching the Marco Recorder
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Performance of Short- and Long-term Baseplates for Attaching the Marco Recorder

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical investigation is to test the safety and performance of short- and longterm Baseplates constructed with different types of biocompatible adhesives.

primary_outcome.measure: Trans epidermal water loss (TEWL) to measure skin-friendliness
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the skin barrier functionality (i.e., skin-friendliness) after repeated use of two types of Baseplates (i.e., adhesives) on the skin behind the ear.

intervention.intervention_name: Baseplates with two types of adhesives are tested: 3M 1522 & Nitto ST-2410WD
intervention.description: Baseplates with two different types of adhesives are placed behind the ears; One baseplate with one of the two types of the adhesive behind each ear

intervention.intervention_name: Baseplates with two types of adhesives are tested: Amparo 130002 & 3M 2480
intervention.description: Baseplates with two different types of adhesives are placed behind the ears; One baseplate with one of the two types of the adhesive behind each ear

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent obtained, and letter of authority signed before any study related activities
- Are at least 18 years of age and have full legal capacity
- Healthy skin behind the ear
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- Known allergic responses to the adhesives
- Treatment with corticosteroids, either as a cream in the area behind the ear or systemically (tablet or injection) within the last month
- Subject is unable or does not have the necessary assistance to properly operate the device system

facility.name: Dermato-Venerologisk Afdeling og Videncenter for Sårheling, Bispebjerg Hospital
